A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Well\, normally I don’t write reviews\, but there are a lot of people on here whining and moaning about how this movie ruined their lives\, so I felt like I had to bring reason to the table. This is an excellently shot\, well written movie. Kylo Ren is an increasingly interesting\, unpredictable villain. Luke is what he’s always been; it’s hard to describe without spoilers\, but he’s always been the one to think he is right\, overconfident. Seeing what happened to him to make him the way he is in this movie made perfect sense\, and it was a really fascinating character arc. I won’t go into every character\, but this movie had so many good things going on with people internally and what makes them grow\, what makes them who they are. I really enjoyed this smart\, funny film that wasn’t afraid to defy expectations and ground things in reality. I’m sorry\, but not everyone is some predestined hero\, and seeing Luke question the ways of Jedis was something I really appreciated. Hats off to this movie. Oh\, and one more thing... how come people hate this movie for being “shallow” but loved Rogue One? That movie had more plot holes than Swiss cheese\, and the characters were cardboard cut outs. Anyways\, don’t rely on other me or others to tell you what to think. See the movie yourself and then make your own opinion.
